GSD.product_version: versions from v5.0 to before v5.15.76
GSD.description:
selinux: enable use of both GFP_KERNEL and GFP_ATOMIC in convert_context()

This is an automated ID intended to aid in discovery of potential security vulnerabilities. The actual impact and attack plausibility have not yet been proven.
This ID is fixed in Linux Kernel version v5.15.76 by commit 3006766d247bc93a25b34e92fff2f75bda597e2e, it was introduced in version v5.0 by commit ee1a84fdfeedfd7362e9a8a8f15fedc3482ade2d. For more details please see the references link.

OSV.summary: selinux: enable use of both GFP_KERNEL and GFP_ATOMIC in convert_context()
OSV.details:
selinux: enable use of both GFP_KERNEL and GFP_ATOMIC in convert_context()

This is an automated ID intended to aid in discovery of potential security vulnerabilities. The actual impact and attack plausibility have not yet been proven.
This ID is fixed in Linux Kernel version v5.15.76 by commit 3006766d247bc93a25b34e92fff2f75bda597e2e, it was introduced in version v5.0 by commit ee1a84fdfeedfd7362e9a8a8f15fedc3482ade2d. For more details please see the references link.
